1.text: Scoop out 8 scoops of ice cream onto a baking sheet.

2.text: Freeze the ice cream balls for 1-2 hours.

3.text: Combine the cornflakes and any other sweet ingredients to make the breading.

5.text: Roll the ice cream balls in the egg whites and breading, then re-freeze them.

6.text: Heat the oil to 375 °F (191 °C) in a large saucepan.

7.text: Fry 1-2 ice cream balls at a time, for 10-30 seconds each.

8.text: Drain the balls on paper towels and serve with toppings.

9.text: Scoop out 8 ice cream balls onto a baking tray.

10.text: Saute the cornflakes and cinnamon in butter until they're golden.

11.text: Stir in the sugar and place the mixture in a bowl.

12.text: Roll the ice cream balls in the cereal mixture.

13.text: Top with chocolate sauce, whipped cream, or other toppings.
